poem:
Title: A Chime for Scholars In Debt

When the pound rings against the register,
An echoing tale of academia in suspense,
Nigerian, Iranian - students overseas,
Their futures threatened by a currency's wane.
The halls of Sussex filled with phantom dreams,
Robes of graduation, an unfilled frame.
Yet despite hardship, they hold their glow,
For knowledge is a debt that constantly grows.
